body:
```
/home/pranavchiku/scipy/scipy/optimize/lbfgsb_src/lbfgsb.f
LFORTRAN_ASSERT failed: /home/pranavchiku/lfortran/src/libasr/asr.h
function down_cast(), line number 40 at 
is_a<T>(*f)
Aborted (core dumped)
```
There are quite a few files in ```scipy/integrate/quadpack``` as well which results in segmentation fault !
You have to enabler stack traces. It's not a segmentation fault, but an assert failure it seems.

Okay, and when I try to build using stack trace it throws me error, so I keep it off and build.
I am using ubuntu 22.04 (linux)
What error do you get? You should always develop LFortran with stacktraces on.
I will post the logs in here asap

On executing ```./build1.sh``` it results in the following error (with ```-DWITH_STACKTRACE=yes```)

We can resolve it over video, I think the bfd in Conda is not compatible or something.

issue.title: Data statement bugfix
issue.body: While checking the files in `scipy/special/amos/` etc in #869 I fell on an error, and I think `current_body` is sometimes not allocated. For this I entered a simple check. However, the issue seems not too hard to surmount: The data assignment statements that throw errors are assignments to existing 1d array items with n elements. @Smit-create
